'''Christopher Daykin''' (born July 18, 1948)<ref name="ind"/> [[Order of the Bath|CB]] is a Fellow of the [[Institute of Actuaries]] and was the [[Government Actuary's Department|Government Actuary]] for the [[United Kingdom]] from 1989 to 2007.<ref name="gad"/><ref name="ioa"/> He is the second longest holder of the post.

He was president of the [[Institute of Actuaries]] between 1994 and 1996.<ref name="ioa"/> He was awarded a [[Order of the Bath|CB]].
He was presented with an Honorary Doctor of Science from City University London 1995 http://www.city.ac.uk/alumni 

Daykin has published reports on issues such as the state pension scheme and co-authored the book ''Practical Risk Theory for Actuaries'' (ISBN 0-412-42850-4).

== Early life ==

He has a first class mathematics degree from [[Pembroke College, Cambridge]] University and attended [[Merchant Taylors' School, Northwood|Merchant Taylors' School, London]].
